name: Make Web Page From Images
short_description:
This tool runs on a Mac. Apple's Safari web browser must be installed, because an AppleScript will send messages to Safari.

- Put images into the "Pictures" folder.

- Optionally, run an AppleScript that creates sound files for the images, and that puts the sound files into the "Sounds" folder. (Ex: if "Dog.jpg" is in the Pictures folder, then the AppleScript creates a sound file called "Dog.aiff", and puts Dog.aiff into the Sounds folder. If you play Dog.aiff, the sound will be someone saying the word "Dog".)

- In a user-interface window, optionally request that in the web page that you're creating, if you click on an image, you will hear the corresponding sound. (Ex: if you click on an image of a file called "Dog.jpg", you will hear someone say "Dog".)

- Click the "Create Web Page" button. The web page will be created.
summary: Create a web page, and optionally sound files, from image files
